revised_title: Spectroscopic Analysis of Cool Flames in Carbon Monoxide Reactions
tldr: The authors studied the spectrum of cool flames in carbon monoxide reactions with oxygen and nitrous oxide. They discovered that the cool flame spectrum has a more distinct band structure and lacks the OH bands found in normal flames. The strong sodium emission in cool flames suggests that atoms take up energy directly from the combustion process, which questions the reliability of the sodium-line reversal method for measuring flame temperatures.
